resources.string: Welcome to the PDIoT App. Use it to connect to your Respeck or Thingy devices.
You can record data from the sensors in a locally stored csv file.
You can also view the live data once the sensors are connected.
Choose sensor by pressing this dropdown
Choose activity type by pressing this dropdown

In the Record Data activity, you can record your own data and have it saved locally to the phone. \n\n
You can choose to record with either the Respeck or Thingy by choosing the sensor from the dropdown. You may also choose which of the 18 activities you want to record. When the sensors are connected, the bottom of the screen shows real time position updates from the two sensors.

In the Watch Live Processing activity, you can see data being graphed from the sensors in real-time. 


The three lines correspond to the x, y, and z axes of the sensors. 


If you do not see any graphs, it is likely that the sensors are not connectedâ€”- see Connect Sensors Help page for more info.

In the Do Some ML activity, the system uses Machine Learning to classify your motion in real-time.

 When the sensors are connected, you can see their live data. The top of the screen shows the motion prediction. The bottom of the screen shows a pie chart showing the percentage of time you have done each activity for the current session. 

 Once you leave this section, your prediction data will automatically be stored on the phone. You may access this data by looking at the Event Log, or by checking the phone's internal storage.

In the Connect Sensors activity, you can pair your device with either a Respeck Sensor or a Thingy Sensor.


In order to get the best classification, make sure to adhere to the following steps. 


1. When using the Respeck:
 Make sure the Respeck is secured to the front left side of your torso, just under your ribs. The white part should face outwards, while the blue part should be pressed up against you. Make sure that the words on the blue side are right side up. 


2. When using the Thingy:
 Make sure the Thingy is placed in your right front pocket with the light facing outwards.


Further instructions can be found on the Connect Sensors page itself.

In the Calibrate Activity, you can train a Deep Learning model based on your own unique movement.

 First, click on the activity you would like to train the model on. There are 18 different activities you can choose from. 

 Then, perform each activity while the sensor is connected to your body and watch the accuracy of the model improve over time!
